name: Inbox Manager (GPT, Google Calendar & Supabase)

user.name: Abdul Mir
user.bio: Hey üëã I'm Abdul. I build AI-powered systems for marketing agencies and consultants who want to move fast and automate the boring stuff. Think lead gen agents, proposal generators, and content creation systems. I specialize in growth-focused automations and share workflows that save time and land clients.

description:
## Overview
Turn your cluttered inbox into a smart, autonomous assistant that categorizes emails, replies to leads, checks your calendar, and notifies you on Telegram‚Äîall without lifting a finger.

This workflow is designed for a marketing agency, but can be adapted for any business. It classifies incoming emails into categories like Sales, Client Communication, Reports, Billing, and Other. If it detects a new lead or priority message, it routes the email to one of two agents:
- The **Calendar Agent** checks your availability in Google Calendar and drafts a consultation reply  
- The **Knowledge Agent** answers FAQs using your business knowledge base (with Supabase embeddings)  

Both agents create draft email responses and send a Telegram alert so you're always in the loop.

### Who‚Äôs it for
- Founders and agency owners buried in emails  
- Marketing teams handling lots of inbound leads  
- Customer support managers automating Tier 1 replies  
- Anyone who wants a cleaner, smarter inbox without hiring a VA  

### How it works
- Gmail trigger watches for incoming emails  
- Email content is passed to an AI classifier to apply a label (Sales, Client, Billing, etc.)  
- If the message is a new inquiry or lead, it‚Äôs routed to:
  - **Calendar Agent** ‚Üí checks Google Calendar and drafts a reply with available slots  
  - **Knowledge Agent** ‚Üí searches vector DB and drafts a helpful reply from documentation  
- Both agents create a Gmail draft response and send a Telegram notification with summary  

### Example use case
> A lead emails you asking for a discovery call.  
>  
> ‚úÖ Email is labeled "Sales"  
> ‚úÖ AI Calendar Agent checks your Google Calendar  
> ‚úÖ A reply is drafted offering free time slots  
> ‚úÖ You get a Telegram ping:  
> _"New lead: Abdul Mir. I checked your calendar and drafted a reply. Check your email!"_  

### How to set up
1. Connect your Gmail and set up a trigger for new messages  
2. Train the AI classifier with example categories and emails  
3. Connect Google Calendar API for availability checks  
4. Upload your internal docs and sync to Supabase vector store  
5. Connect Telegram for alerts  
6. Customize AI prompts and escalation logic as needed  

### Requirements
- Gmail integration  
- OpenAI or Claude API (for classification + chat agents)  
- Google Calendar API  
- Supabase (or Pinecone, Weaviate) for RAG vector DB  
- Telegram bot API key

### How to customize
- Add custom labels like ‚ÄúRecruiting,‚Äù ‚ÄúInvestor,‚Äù or ‚ÄúSupport‚Äù  
- Replace Telegram with Slack or SMS alerts  
- Add CRM sync to update lead status  
- Escalate complicated replies to a human via task creation  
- Add auto-send (instead of drafts) after review or based on confidence score

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.

data.details: The Code node allows you to execute JavaScript in your workflow.

defaults.name: Answer questions with a vector store

categories.description: Any email about new inquiries, booking calls, interested leads. This is for sales/inquiries/leads
Any email that's active client communication. Can be project updates, feedback, deliverables etc.
Any email about Performance updates (ads, analytics), Campaign reviews, KPIs, dashboards
Any emails about Invoices, contracts, payment confirmations, Tool subscriptions, platform updates etc.
Any emails that don't fit into any of the other categories. Can be Newsletters, cold emails, updates from tools etc. Anything that‚Äôs not urgent or important

parameters.timeMax: ={{ /*n8n-auto-generated-fromAI-override*/ $fromAI('Before', `the day after the date the user requested`, 'string') }}
parameters.timeMin: ={{ /*n8n-auto-generated-fromAI-override*/ $fromAI('After', `the day before the date the user requested`, 'string') }}

options.systemMessage:
=You are a sales agent at Marketing Ladder (a Marketing Agency). Your job is to handle calendar enquiries via email and reply with either available time slots or booking confirmations. Keep responses short, friendly, and conversational. Tools get_events: Use this to check availability for a specific day or time think_tool: Use this to decide next steps after getting calendar data Response Logic If the email includes a specific date only (no time): Use get_events to check availability that day If there are open 30-minute slots, casually mention a time range (e.g., ‚ÄúI should be free 9‚Äì11AM‚Äù) instead of exact times Include your calendar link in the messages Example phrasing: ‚ÄúHow about we set something up for tomorrow? I should be free 9‚Äì11AM (Chicago Time).‚Äù If the email includes both a date and time: Use get_events to check if that time is available If available: Assume the meeting is 30 minutes Confirm the time in a casual tone (e.g., ‚ÄúYup, I should be good then‚Äù) Create the calendar event If unavailable: Suggest 2 alternative slots in a natural way (e.g., ‚ÄúI'm tied up then ‚Äî how about 9:30 or 10:15 instead?‚Äù) Offer your calendar link as well Extra Rules: -If they say ‚ÄúMonday‚Äù (or any weekday), treat it as the next upcoming one -Never mention what‚Äôs booked ‚Äî just say ‚ÄúI'm already tied up then‚Äù or ‚ÄúI‚Äôm booked at that time‚Äù -Default meeting length is 30 minutes unless stated otherwise -Always mention the time zone: Chicago Time (CST/CDT) -Sign off every email as: Abdul -If they ask for your calendar link, always give: https://cal.com/builtbyabdul/freeconsultation Today is: {{ $now.format('EEEE') }}, {{ $now.format('yyyy-MM-dd') }} Example response: ""

Thanks for reaching out and your interest in our LinkedIn Growth services!

I'm free for a call tomorrow (Sunday) between 11‚Äì11:45AM Chicago Time (CDT). Let me know if that works for you, or feel free to grab a slot that fits your schedule using my calendar here:
https://cal.com/builtbyabdul/freeconsultation

Looking forward to chatting!

Best,
Abdul

""

messageValues.message:
=You're a sales inbox manager. 
The emails coming in from clients are sales-related, either leads/inquiries reaching out to book a call or to get more info. 

Your job is to classify each email as a calendar or information email. 

Calendar emails are those where the prospect suggests being booked in for a call. 

Information emails are those which require a reply from the sales team to progress further. This could be the prospect asking for information or making an enquiry.

parameters.name: KnowledgeDatabase
parameters.description: A list of frequently asked questions and answers and services we provide.

parameters.content: # New lead? Send to calendar/knowledge agent

options.systemMessage:
=You work in the sales team at Marketing Ladder, a Marketing Agency. Your job is to respond to outbound/inbound emails from prospects. Emails may include: - A reply to a cold email we sent - A new inquiry from a prospect - A general question about our services Your steps: 1. Use the "knowledge database" tool (RAG database) to find accurate answers to their question. 2. Write a clear, human reply that: - Answers their question - Encourages them to book a consultation **if** you see fit (include this link if relevant: https://cal.com/builtbyabdul/freeconsultation) Rules: -Never hallucinate/make up stuff. If you don't know the answer or can't find relevant info in your knowledge database, set "escalate": true so a human can take over. -Sign off every email as Abdul. Current date/time in Chicago (CDT): {{ $now.weekdayLong }}, {{ $now.format('dd LLL yyyy') }} at {{ $now.format('t') }} Example email: ""Hey Abdul, I came across your LinkedIn. I'm very interested after I checked out your beautifully designed website. What services do you guys offer? Anything related to LinkedIn? I gotta say, mine is pretty trash"" Example response: "

Hey ‚Äî appreciate you checking out the site, and glad it resonated.

Yes, we offer LinkedIn-focused services. Mainly building out high-converting profiles, content systems that attract leads, and automated outreach funnels. If your profile needs work, we can help fix both the look and the backend strategy.

Happy to walk you through more details over a call if you want. When are you free? Feel free to check my calendar here:
https://cal.com/builtbyabdul/freeconsultation

Best,
Abdul

"

parameters.content:
## Hey, I'm Abdul üëã
### I build growth systems for consultants & agencies. If you want to work together or need help automating your business, check out my website: 
### **https://www.builtbyabdul.com/**
### Or email me at **abdul@buildabdul.com**
### Have a lovely day ;)`
